title: This low-cost adapter lets older cars connect to Apple CarPlay and Android Auto wirelessly
content:
Macworld

Not all cars can use Apple CarPlay or Android Auto wirelessly. It’s a common frustration, but it’s also easily solved. The PlayAIBox is a plug-and-play adapter that lets you wirelessly connect your phone to your car. It even supports streaming services. And instead of paying $129 for a PlayAIBox, you can get one on sale for $84.97 (for now). 

No more dealing with cables every time you get in the car. Just plug in the PlayAIBox, and your phone will connect wirelessly every time you start your car. Whether you’re navigating with Google Maps, taking hands-free calls, or queuing up your favorite road trip playlist, everything works seamlessly without the hassle of plugging in your phone.

Built-in YouTube and Netflix means your passengers can watch their favorite shows on long drives. And since it supports the Google Play Store, you can even download additional apps like Hulu or Disney+.

The PlayAIBox is compatible with most cars from 2016 and newer that have wired CarPlay, and it works with both iPhones and Android devices.

You have until March 30 at 11:59 p.m. PT to get the PlayAIBox Adapter on sale for $84.97.
